questions.questionText: In the novel Family Matters by Canadian writer Rohinton Mistry, the character Nariman Vakeel is afflicted by Parkinson’s disease and is haunted by memories of his past.

answerOptions.responseText: Try again! Did you think about how paranoia is an internal struggle?
Not quite! Nariman Vakeel struggles with Character vs Self conflict (his own memories).
